meanings.definition: A group of military officers ruling a country after seizing power.
meanings.sent1: The juntas in the country took control after the coup.
meanings.sent2: The juntas gathered to discuss their plans for the nation.
meanings.sent3: The juntas decided to host a surprise party for the citizens.
meanings.sent4: The juntas' influence spread like wildfire across the land.
meanings.sent5: The image of the juntas in their uniforms was intimidating.

meanings.definition: A small group of people, especially one involved in a secret or illegal activity.
meanings.sent1: The juntas met in the dark alley to plan their next move.
meanings.sent2: She suspected a juntas was behind the mysterious disappearances.
meanings.sent3: The juntas' secret handshake was known only to its members.
meanings.sent4: Their juntas operated like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the juntas added an air of mystery to the situation.
